definition: To gradually lose its original vividness or intensity, often referring to colors, images, or memories. It is commonly used to describe the fading or dimming of something over time.

examples.german: Die Farben verblassen mit der Zeit.
Die Hoffnung verblassend, gab er auf.
Die Bilder verblassen in der Sonne.
examples.english: The pictures fade in the sun.

examples.german: Die Schrift verblassend, war kaum lesbar.
examples.english: The fading writing was barely legible.
